resources.string:
To add a new entry, press the + button at the bottom right corner and select \'Entry\'.

To add a newspaper article, press the + button at the bottom right corner, select \'Newspaper Article\' and enter the url of a newspaper site or a RSS feed url.

Tags are used to organize your entries.

To add a tag to an entry, select an entry in tab \'Entries\' and press on \'Tags\'. Enter the name of your new tag and press \'New\'.

You can add references to your entries to remember where you found that entry.

To add a reference to an entry, select an entry in tab \'Entries\' and press on \'Reference\'.
Enter the title of your new reference and press the save icon.

If you don\'t have time to read an article now or will come soon to an area with bad internet connection you can save an article for later reading.

Articles for later reading are stored offline so that you can read them without internet connection, but are not saved yet to your entries collection.

To add an article for later reading, press the + button at the bottom right corner, press \'Newspaper Article\', select a newspaper site and in the new window with all articles of that newspaper site, long press an article and select \'Read later\' at the bottom.

Click here to set entry\'s information (the data you actually want to save).

(Click on the fields above or the + button at bottom right edge to set entry\'s abstract, reference and tags.)

If you want to execute an action on only one item, swipe the item from right to left.\nIf you want to execute an action on multiple items, long press that item.\nThis behaviour is valid for almost all lists. Try it.
To search for multiple tags, enter a comma (,).\nTo filter entered tags, press the action button (\'Enter\') on keyboard.
To select multiple tags, enter a comma (,).\nTo create a new or toggle entered tags, press the action button (\'Enter\') on keyboard.
The changes done are now only applied, to save them press the \'Save\' button at bottom right.
Scrolling entry\'s information as you just did starts fullscreen mode.\nYou can leave it by simply tapping anywhere except on links and images in the screen.

You just invoked one of the fullscreen gestures:

- Fast swipe from right to left: Leave edit entry view
- Fast swipe from left to right: Edit entry's tags
- Double tap: Save entry and close edit entry view.
Feed or website url\n(e.g. nytimes.com or https://www.theguardian.com/uk/rss)
Add meaningful tags, so that you can find it later easily
Save where you have found this information
Title or summary for this information
Entry contains unsaved changes.\n\nShould these changes now be saved?
Entry has been edited (probably on a synchronized device).\n\nWhen you now save the entry the other changes get overwritten.
Would you like to delete entry \'%s\'?

plurals.name: dialog_tags_on_entry_confirm_create_tags
plurals.item: Tag %1$s does not exist.\nWould you like to create it?
Tags %1$s and %2$s do not exist.\nWould you like to create them?

resources.string: Reference contains unsaved changes.\n\nShould these changes now be saved?
Reference has been edited (probably on a synchronized device).\n\nWhen you now save the reference the other changes get overwritten.
Reihe enthält nicht gespeicherte Änderungen.\n\nSollen diese Änderungen nun gespeichert werden?
Series has been edited (probably on a synchronized device).\n\nWhen you now save the series the other changes get overwritten.
Entered Code was wrong.\nEnter Code shown on %s:
No RSS or Atom feed found for url %s
Cannot read feed or extract feed addresses from url %s: %s

Wir respektieren selbstverständlich die Meinungsfreiheit.\nWir haben jedoch sehr viel Zeit und Mühe in diese App gesteckt und möchten nicht, dass unsere Mühen verwendet werden solch ein hetzerisches und verlogenes Machwerk wie die Bild zu lesen. Die Welt wäre eine bessere ohne Bild.\nDie App wird zur Strafe nun abstürzen.
